values.text: What county are you asking about?
Various resources for voting security are found here.

Early voting dates and times vary among States. For information, contact your State or local election office.

source: https://www.eac.gov/sites/default/files/eac_assets/1/28/Voter'sGuide_508.pdf
Find historical results for federal elections here.
For a comprehensive look at U.S. voting laws and rights, go <href="https://www.usa.gov/voting-laws" target="_blank">here<a/>.

In Texas, you are eligible to register to vote if:
  • You are a United States citizen;
  • You are a resident of the county where you submit the application;
  • You are at least 17 years and 10 months old, and you are 18 years of age on Election Day.
  • You are not a convicted felon; and
  • You have not been declared by a court exercising probate jurisdiction to be either totally mentally incapacitated or partially mentally incapacitated without the right to vote.

dialog_nodes.title: NO - don't know if I'm eligible to register

values.text: All Polling Places in Texas Must be Accessible On September 1, 1999, Texas became the first state to require that all new voting systems be accessible to voters with disabilities. Voters May Receive Assistance at the Polls. Tell the election official if you are a voter who needs help to vote. You do not have to provide proof of your disability. If a voter is physically unable to enter the polling place, he or she may ask that an election officer bring a ballot to the entrance of the polling place or to a car parked at the curbside. If you plan to go alone to vote curbside, it is wise to call ahead so election officials will expect you. Consult the Voters with Disabilities web page at VoteTexas.org for more details and voting advice for people with special needs.
Implications depend on the state.
Forms to update voter registration details are found here.

To vote in Texas, you must be registered. Simply pick up a voter registration application, fill it out, and mail it at least 30 days before the election date. Apply for voter registration online here.

generic.title: Do you know if you are eligible to register to vote?

values.text: I understand your concerns regarding your personal information and privacy.  I can assure you that your information is being handled in a secure fashion and is only being used in so far as to help guide our responses to you.  We value your privacy and security.

This virtual agent is powered by IBM Watson. IBM respects your privacy, and takes your information and trust seriously. IBM does not gather this information to train other services, and only uses your conversational data as needed to provide your responses and guidance in using this service. For further information feel free to download the Watson Privacy, Compliance, & Security POV for an in-depth look at IBM's data privacy and security perspective.
Before you can vote, you must first register to vote.

generic.title: Do you want to register to vote?

values.text:

Information on becoming a poll worker is found here here. For laws and statutes regarding poll workers, look here.

Hello! I am the Texas Voting virtual assistant powered by IBM Watson.

I will answer your questions about how to register to vote in Texas, when elections are scheduled, and what is on the ballot for the election.
But first let me know which language you are most comfortable using.
Dígame qué idioma se siente más cómodo usando.
Find voter identification requirements for your state here.

dialog_nodes.title: Check if already registered to vote

values.text: For the November 3, 2020 Election: Last Day to Register to Vote: Monday, October 5, 2020 First Day of Early Voting: Tuesday, October 13, 2020 Last Day to Apply for Ballot by Mail: Friday, October 23, 2020 Last Day of Early Voting: Friday, October 30, 2020 Last day to Receive Ballot by Mail: Tuesday, November 3, 2020 (Election Day) More details about the Election Calendar are available here.
No problem, is there anything else I can help you with?
Got it.  I hope that was helpful.  Is there anything else I can assist you with?

dialog_nodes.title: Yes, I want more Absentee info

values.text: When you arrive at the polling place, you will be asked to present one of the seven (7) acceptable forms of photo identification, unless you are a voter with a permanent exemption on your voter registration certificate.
Find information on the availability of same day voter registration in your state here.

On your Voter Registration certificate, you will see a precinct number. Your residence is located in a specific “precinct” or area within the county where you will vote on Election Day. During Early Voting, registered and eligible voters may vote at ANY early voting location located in the county of residence. Note that polling place hours vary at each early voting location. On Election day, if your county participates in the Countywide Polling Place Program (CWPP), you can vote at any location in your county of registration. If your county does not participate in the CWPP, you can only vote at the voting precinct assigned to you. Election Day voting hours are 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. at all polling places statewide. For more details about voting locations in Texas and associated rules, consult the web pages for VoteTexas.gov

generic.title: For which election are you inquiring?

You can also view historical election results.
